Package org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree

Class DiffNode

java.lang.Object
org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode
public class DiffNode extends Object
Implementation of a node in a DiffTree. A DiffNode represents a single node within a variation tree diff (according to our ESEC/FSE'22 paper), but is specialized to the target domain of preprocessor-based software product lines. Thus, opposed to the generic mathematical model of variation tree diffs, a DiffNode always stores lines of text, line numbers, and child ordering information as its label. Each DiffNode may be edited according to its DiffType and represents a source code element according to its CodeType. DiffNode's store parent and child information to build a graph.
Author:
Paul Bittner, SÃ¶ren Viegener, Benjamin Moosherr

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    DiffType
    diffType
    The diff type of this node, which determines if this node represents an inserted, removed, or unchanged element in a diff.
    NodeType
    nodeType
    The node type of this node, which determines the type of the represented element in the diff (e.g., mapping or artifact).

    DiffNode​(DiffType diffType, NodeType nodeType, DiffLineNumber fromLines, DiffLineNumber toLines, org.prop4j.Node featureMapping, List<String> lines)
    The same as DiffNode(DiffType, NodeType, DiffLineNumber, DiffLineNumber, Node, String) but with the label separated into different lines of text instead of as a single String with newlines.

  • Field Details

    • diffType

      public final DiffType diffType
      The diff type of this node, which determines if this node represents an inserted, removed, or unchanged element in a diff.

    • nodeType

      public final NodeType nodeType
      The node type of this node, which determines the type of the represented element in the diff (e.g., mapping or artifact).

  • Constructor Details

    • DiffNode

      public DiffNode​(DiffType diffType, NodeType nodeType, DiffLineNumber fromLines, DiffLineNumber toLines, org.prop4j.Node featureMapping, String label)
      Creates a DiffNode with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      diffType - The type of change made to this node.
      nodeType - The type of this node (i.e., mapping or artifact).
      fromLines - The starting line number of the corresponding text.
      toLines - The ending line number of the corresponding text.
      featureMapping - The formula stored in this node. Should be null for artifact nodes.
      label - A text label containing information to identify the node (such as the corresponding source code).

    • DiffNode

      public DiffNode​(DiffType diffType, NodeType nodeType, DiffLineNumber fromLines, DiffLineNumber toLines, org.prop4j.Node featureMapping, List<String> lines)
      The same as DiffNode(DiffType, NodeType, DiffLineNumber, DiffLineNumber, Node, String) but with the label separated into different lines of text instead of as a single String with newlines.

  • Method Details

    • createRoot

      public static DiffNode createRoot()
      Creates a new root node. The root is a neutral annotation (i.e., its feature mapping is "true").

    • createArtifact

      public static DiffNode createArtifact​(DiffType diffType, DiffLineNumber fromLines, DiffLineNumber toLines, String code)
      Creates an artifact node with the given parameters. For parameter descriptions, see DiffNode(DiffType, NodeType, DiffLineNumber, DiffLineNumber, Node, String). The code parameter will be set as the node's label.

    • createArtifact

      public static DiffNode createArtifact​(DiffType diffType, DiffLineNumber fromLines, DiffLineNumber toLines, List<String> lines)
      The same as createArtifact(DiffType, DiffLineNumber, DiffLineNumber, String) but with the code for the label given as a list of individual lines instead of a single String with linebreaks to identify newlines.

    • addLines

      public void addLines​(List<String> lines)
      Adds the given lines to the source code lines of this node.
      Parameters:
      lines - Lines to add.

    • getLines

      public List<String> getLines()
      Returns the lines in the diff that are represented by this DiffNode.

    • getLabel

      public String getLabel()
      Returns the lines in the diff that are represented by this DiffNode as a single text.
      See Also:
      getLines()

    • setLabel

      public void setLabel​(String label)
      Sets the the lines in the diff that are represented by this DiffNode to the given code. Lines are identified by linebreak characters.

      public boolean beforePathEqualsAfterPath()

    • addBelow

      public boolean addBelow​(DiffNode newBeforeParent, DiffNode newAfterParent)
      Adds thus subtree below the given parents. Inverse of drop.
      Parameters:
      newBeforeParent - Node that should be this node's before parent. May be null.
      newAfterParent - Node that should be this node's after parent. May be null.
      Returns:
      True iff this node could be added as child to at least one of the given non-null parents.

    • drop

      public void drop()
      Removes this subtree from its parents. Inverse of addBelow.

    • indexOfChild

      public int indexOfChild​(DiffNode child)
      Returns the index of the given child in the list of children of thus node. Returns -1 if the given node is not a child of this node.

    • insertChildAt

      public boolean insertChildAt​(DiffNode child, int index, Time time)
      Adds the given node for the given time at the given index as the child.
      Parameters:
      child - The new child to add. This node should not be a child of another node for the given time.
      index - The index at which the node should be inserted into the children list.
      time - The time at which this node should be the parent of this node. For example, if the time is BEFORE, then this node will become the before parent of the given node.
      Returns:
      True iff the insertion was successful. False iff the child could not be added.
      See Also:
      insertBeforeChild(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode, int), insertAfterChild(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode, int)

    • insertBeforeChild

      public boolean insertBeforeChild​(DiffNode child, int index)
      The same as insertChildAt(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode, int, org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.Time) but the time fixed to BEFORE.

    • insertAfterChild

      public boolean insertAfterChild​(DiffNode child, int index)
      The same as insertChildAt(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode, int, org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.Time) but the time fixed to AFTER.

    • addBeforeChild

      public boolean addBeforeChild​(DiffNode child)
      The same as insertBeforeChild(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode, int) but puts the node at the end of the children list instead of inserting it at a specific index.

    • addAfterChild

      public boolean addAfterChild​(DiffNode child)
      The same as insertAfterChild(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode, int) but puts the node at the end of the children list instead of inserting it at a specific index.

    • addBeforeChildren

      public void addBeforeChildren​(Collection<DiffNode> beforeChildren)
      Adds all given nodes as before children using addBeforeChild(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode).
      Parameters:
      beforeChildren - Nodes to add as children before the edit.

    • addAfterChildren

      public void addAfterChildren​(Collection<DiffNode> afterChildren)
      Adds all given nodes as after children using addAfterChild(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode).
      Parameters:
      afterChildren - Nodes to add as children after the edit.

    • removeBeforeChild

      public boolean removeBeforeChild​(DiffNode child)
      Removes the given node from this node's children before the edit. The node might still remain a child after the edit.
      Parameters:
      child - The child to remove before the edit.
      Returns:
      True iff the child was removed, false iff it was no before child.

    • removeAfterChild

      public boolean removeAfterChild​(DiffNode child)
      Removes the given node from this node's children after the edit. The node might still remain a child before the edit.
      Parameters:
      child - The child to remove after the edit.
      Returns:
      True iff the child was removed, false iff it was no after child.

    • removeChildren

      public void removeChildren​(Collection<DiffNode> childrenToRemove)
      Removes all given children for all times. None of the given nodes will be a child, neither before nor after the edit, afterwards.
      Parameters:
      childrenToRemove - Nodes that should not be children of this node anymore.

    • removeBeforeChildren

      public List<DiffNode> removeBeforeChildren()
      Removes all children before the edit. Afterwards, this node will have no before children.
      Returns:
      All removed before children.

    • removeAfterChildren

      public List<DiffNode> removeAfterChildren()
      Removes all children after the edit. Afterwards, this node will have no after children.
      Returns:
      All removed after children.

    • stealChildrenOf

      public void stealChildrenOf​(DiffNode other)
      Removes all children from the given node and adds them as children to this node at the respective times. The order of children is not stable because first all before children are transferred and then all after children. The given node will have no children afterwards.
      Parameters:
      other - The node whose children should be stolen.

    • getBeforeParent

      public DiffNode getBeforeParent()
      Returns the parent of this node before the edit.

    • getAfterParent

      public DiffNode getAfterParent()
      Returns the parent of this node after the edit.

    • getFromLine

      public DiffLineNumber getFromLine()
      Returns the starting line number of this node's corresponding text block.

    • getToLine

      public DiffLineNumber getToLine()
      Returns the end line number of this node's corresponding text block. The line number is exclusive (i.e., it points 1 behind the last included line).

    • getLinesInDiff

      public Lines getLinesInDiff()
      Returns the range of line numbers of this node's corresponding source code in the text-based diff.
      See Also:
      DiffLineNumber.rangeInDiff(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.DiffLineNumber, org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.DiffLineNumber)

    • getLinesBeforeEdit

      public Lines getLinesBeforeEdit()
      Returns the range of line numbers of this node's corresponding source code before the edit.
      See Also:
      DiffLineNumber.rangeBeforeEdit(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.DiffLineNumber, org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.DiffLineNumber)

    • getLinesAfterEdit

      public Lines getLinesAfterEdit()
      Returns the range of line numbers of this node's corresponding source code after the edit.
      See Also:
      DiffLineNumber.rangeAfterEdit(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.DiffLineNumber, org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.DiffLineNumber)

    • getDirectFeatureMapping

      public org.prop4j.Node getDirectFeatureMapping()
      Returns the formula that is stored in this node. The formula is null for artifact nodes (i.e., NodeType.ARTIFACT). The formula is not null for mapping nodes
      See Also:
      NodeType.isAnnotation()

    • getChildOrder

      public List<DiffNode> getChildOrder()
      Returns the list representing the order of the children. Any child occurs exactly once, even if this node is it's before and after parent.

    • getAllChildren

      public List<DiffNode> getAllChildren()
      Legacy alias for getChildOrder().

    • setIsMultilineMacro

      public void setIsMultilineMacro​(boolean isMultilineMacro)
      Determines if this node represents a multi-line macro.
      Parameters:
      isMultilineMacro - True iff this node represents a multi-line macro.

    • isMultilineMacro

      public boolean isMultilineMacro()
      Returns true if this node represents a multi-line macro.

    • getBeforeFeatureMapping

      public org.prop4j.Node getBeforeFeatureMapping()
      Returns the full feature mapping formula of this node before the edit. The feature mapping of an NodeType.IF node is its direct feature mapping. The feature mapping of NodeType.ELSE and NodeType.ELIF nodes is determined by all formulas in the respective if-elif-else chain. The feature mapping of an artifact node is the feature mapping of its parent. See Equation (1) in our paper (+ its extension to time for variation tree diffs described in Section 3.1).
      Returns:
      The feature mapping of this node for the given parent edges.

    • getAfterFeatureMapping

      public org.prop4j.Node getAfterFeatureMapping()
      Returns the full feature mapping formula of this node after the edit. The feature mapping of an NodeType.IF node is its direct feature mapping. The feature mapping of NodeType.ELSE and NodeType.ELIF nodes is determined by all formulas in the respective if-elif-else chain. The feature mapping of an artifact node is the feature mapping of its parent. See Equation (1) in our paper (+ its extension to time for variation tree diffs described in Section 3.1).
      Returns:
      The feature mapping of this node for the given parent edges.

    • getFeatureMapping

      public org.prop4j.Node getFeatureMapping​(Time time)
      Depending on the given time, returns either the before feature mapping or after feature mapping.

    • getBeforePresenceCondition

      public org.prop4j.Node getBeforePresenceCondition()
      Returns the presence condition of this node before the edit. See Equation (2) in our paper (+ its extension to time for variation tree diffs described in Section 3.1).
      Returns:
      The presence condition of this node for the given parent edges.

    • getAfterPresenceCondition

      public org.prop4j.Node getAfterPresenceCondition()
      Returns the presence condition of this node after the edit. See Equation (2) in our paper (+ its extension to time for variation tree diffs described in Section 3.1).
      Returns:
      The presence condition of this node for the given parent edges.

    • getPresenceCondition

      public org.prop4j.Node getPresenceCondition​(Time time)
      Depending on the given time, returns either the before presence condition or after presence condition.

    • isBeforeChild

      public boolean isBeforeChild​(DiffNode child)
      Returns true iff this node is the before parent of the given node.

    • isAfterChild

      public boolean isAfterChild​(DiffNode child)
      Returns true iff this node is the after parent of the given node.

    • isChild

      public boolean isChild​(DiffNode child)
      Returns true iff this node is the before or after parent of the given node.

    • isChild

      public boolean isChild​(DiffNode child, Time time)
      Returns true iff this node is the parent of the given node at the given time.

    • isLeaf

      public boolean isLeaf()
      Returns true iff this node has no children.

    • isRem

      public boolean isRem()
      Returns true iff this node represents a removed element.
      See Also:
      DiffType.REM

    • isNon

      public boolean isNon()
      Returns true iff this node represents an unchanged element.

      public boolean isAdd()
      Returns true iff this node represents an inserted element.

    • getDiffType

      public DiffType getDiffType()
      Returns the diff type of this node.

      public boolean isElif()

    • isIf

      public boolean isIf()
      Returns true if this node represents a conditional annotation.

    • isArtifact

      public boolean isArtifact()
      Returns true if this node is an artifact node.
      See Also:
      NodeType.ARTIFACT

    • isEndif

      public boolean isEndif()
      Returns true if this node represents the end of an annotation block. Such a node should not be part of any DiffTree.
      See Also:
      NodeType.ENDIF

    • isElse

      public boolean isElse()
      Returns true if this node represents an ELSE annotation.
      See Also:
      NodeType.ELSE

    • isRoot

      public boolean isRoot()
      Returns true if this node is a root node (i.e., it has NodeType.ROOT.

    • isAnnotation

      public boolean isAnnotation()
      Returns NodeType.isAnnotation() for this node's nodeType.

    • getID

      public int getID()
      Returns:
      An integer that uniquely identifiers this DiffNode within its patch. From the returned id a new node with all essential attributes reconstructed can be obtained by using fromID(int, java.lang.String). Note that only 26 bits of the line number are encoded, so if the line number is bigger than 2^26, this id will no longer be unique.

    • fromID

      public static DiffNode fromID​(int id, String label)
      Reconstructs a node from the given id and sets the given label. An id uniquely determines a node's nodeType, diffType, and line number in the diff. The almost-inverse function is getID() but the conversion is not lossless.
      Parameters:
      id - The id from which to reconstruct the node.
      label - The label the node should have.
      Returns:
      The reconstructed DiffNode.

    • assertConsistency

      public void assertConsistency()
      Checks that the DiffTree is in a valid state. In particular, this method checks that all edges are well-formed (e.g., edges can be inconsistent because edges are double-linked). This method also checks that a node with exactly one parent was edited, and that a node with exactly two parents was not edited.
      Throws:
      AssertionError - when an inconsistency is detected.
      See Also:
      Assert.assertTrue(boolean)

    • assertSemanticConsistency

      public void assertSemanticConsistency()
      Checks that Else and Elif nodes have an If or Elif as parent.
      Throws:
      AssertionError - when an inconsistency is detected.

    • toTextDiffLine

      public static String toTextDiffLine​(DiffType diffType, List<String> lines)
      Prepends the DiffType.symbol of the given diffType to all given lines and joins all lines with linebreaks to a single text.
      Parameters:
      diffType - The change type of the given diff hunk.
      lines - The lines to turn into a text-based diff.
      Returns:
      A diff in which all given lines have the given diff type.

    • toTextDiffLine

      public String toTextDiffLine()
      Unparses this node's lines into its original text-based diff.
      Returns:
      The diff from which this node was parsed, reconstructed as accurately as possible.

    • toTextDiff

      public String toTextDiff()
      Unparses this subgraph into its original text-based diff. This will return the diff of the entire subgraph starting with this node as root. Recursively invokes toTextDiffLine() on this node and all its descendants.
      Returns:
      The diff from which this subgraph was parsed, reconstructed as accurately as possible.

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object o)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Compute a hash using all available attributes. This implementation doesn't strictly adhere to the contract required by Object, because some attributes (for example the line numbers) can be changed during the lifetime of a DiffNode. So when using something like a HashSet the user of DiffNode has to be careful not to change any attributes of a stored DiffNode.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
